means: Joint Operations Group 联合军事行动小组
Junior Offshore Group 初级海岸队
run ： 最普通用词，指由于各种原因而急速奔跑。
jog ： 指从容不迫地慢跑。
race ： 多用于赛跑，指以最快速度奔跑。
trot ： 强调小跑时上下弹跳的动作，是介于跑与走之间轻快的快速运动。

sentence.Network_en: They set off at a jog up one street and down another.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们开始沿着一条又一条的街道慢跑。

sentence.Network_en: He went for another early morning jog.
Our lives just jog along from day to day.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们的生活安稳地过了一天又一天.

jx.jx_en_mean: cause someone to remember something suddenly

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'stab, pierce'): variant of jag

entry.def: If you jog, you run slowly, often as a form of exercise.

example.ex: I got up early the next morning to jog...
example.tran: 第二天早晨我一大早起来去慢跑。

example.ex: He could scarcely jog around the block that first day.
example.tran: 第一天他勉强绕着整个街区跑了下来。

entry.def: If you jog something, you push or bump it slightly so that it moves.
If something or someone jogs your memory, they cause you to suddenly remember something that you had forgotten.

example.ex: Police have planned a reconstruction of the crime tomorrow in the hope this will jog the memory of passers-by.
example.tran: 警方已计划明天再现犯罪现场，希望当时路过的人能想起些什么。

sentences.sentence: "there was a jog in the road"

means.word_mean: 1. continue talking or writing in a desultory manner;
2. even up the edges of a stack of paper, in printing
4. run at a moderately swift pace

sentences.en: He jogged out to see what happened.
sentences.cn: 他慢吞吞地走出去看外边发生了什么事。

sentences.en: I gave him a jog to wake him up.
sentences.cn: 我轻轻推了他一下, 叫醒他。

sentences.en: I go for a jog in the park every morning.
sentences.cn: 每天早晨我在公园里慢跑。

jushi.english: The truck jogged up and down.
She jogs round the park for half an hour every morning.
jushi.chinese: 她每天早上绕公园慢跑半小时。
